what: A Microsimulation Model of Osteoarthritis in Australia (AUS-OA)
title: A Microsimulation Model of Osteoarthritis in Australia (AUS-OA)
text: AUS-OA dynamic discrete-time microsimulation model osteoarthritis treatment Australia. aims provide policymakers researchers enhanced capacity evaluate burden treatment osteoarthritis across Australia.  Live Site: https://edithatogo.github.io/microsim_oa/

title: A Microsimulation Model of Osteoarthritis in Australia (AUS-OA)
text: project evolved significantly original version. ’s summary current features:

title: A Microsimulation Model of Osteoarthritis in Australia (AUS-OA)
A Microsimulation Model of Osteoarthritis in Australia (AUS-OA)
text: Clone repository: bash     git clone https://github.com/edithatogo/microsim_oa.git     cd microsim_oa Install dependencies: project uses renv manage dependencies. Open AUS-OA.Rproj file RStudio, renv automatically start installing required packages. , run following command R console: r     renv::restore()

title: A Microsimulation Model of Osteoarthritis in Australia (AUS-OA)
text: Create scenario: Navigate input/scenarios/ copy existing scenario file (e.g., ausoa_input_public.xlsx). Rename something descriptive (e.g., my_scenario.xlsx). Customize scenario: Open new scenario file modify parameters needed. Run master script: Open run scripts/00_AUS_OA_Master.R script R. prompted select scenario file. simulation run, outputs saved output/ directory.

title: A Microsimulation Model of Osteoarthritis in Australia (AUS-OA)
text: R/: Contains core functions simulation model. scripts/: Contains scripts running simulation, preprocessing data, analyzing results. input/: Contains input data model, including population data simulation scenarios. output/: Contains outputs simulation, including logs, model statistics, figures. config/: Contains configuration files model, coefficients intervention parameters. man/: Contains documentation functions R/ directory. tests/: Contains unit tests model, using testthat framework. supporting_data/: Contains data used model validation.

title: A Microsimulation Model of Osteoarthritis in Australia (AUS-OA)
text: project uses structured development approach: Dependency Management: renv used ensure reproducible environment. Testing: testthat used unit testing. can run tests using run_tests.R script scripts/ directory. Style: consistent code style encouraged.

title: A Microsimulation Model of Osteoarthritis in Australia (AUS-OA)
text: surface warning zero-length mortality hazard encountered cycle (default silent fallback 1.0), set: r     options(ausoa.warn_zero_length_hr_mort = TRUE) can help diagnose missing coefficients filtered data situations custom runs.

title: A Microsimulation Model of Osteoarthritis in Australia (AUS-OA)
text: use model research, please cite follows: details source references, see docs/CITATIONS.md.
code: AUS-OA Team (2025). A Microsimulation Model of Osteoarthritis in Australia (Version 2.0.0) [Computer software]. https://github.com/edithatogo/microsim_oa

title: A Microsimulation Model of Osteoarthritis in Australia (AUS-OA)

title: Summarise Osteoarthritis (OA) Data — OA_summary_fcn
text: Processes full simulation output calculate prevalence OA, stratified year, age group, sex.

title: Summarise Osteoarthritis (OA) Data — OA_summary_fcn
text: am_all data.frame representing full simulation output.

title: Update Osteoarthritis (OA) Status — OA_update
text: function models initiation progression osteoarthritis (OA) one simulation cycle. calculates probability developing OA (KL grade 2) progressing KL grades 3 4 based various risk factors.

title: Update Osteoarthritis (OA) Status — OA_update
text: am_curr data.table representing attribute matrix current cycle. contains state population update. am_new data.table representing attribute matrix next cycle. updated OA status stored. cycle.coefficents list data.frame model coefficients OA initiation progression equations, also contains SF-6D utility decrements. OA_cust data.frame customisation factors OA coefficients.

title: Update Osteoarthritis (OA) Status — OA_update
text: list containing two data.tables: am_curr input am_curr intermediate calculations updated sf6d_change column. am_new am_new data.table updated OA status (oa, kl2, kl3, kl4, kl_score).

what: Calculate TKA Revision Risk (Batch Processing Version) — TKA_revisions
title: Calculate TKA Revision Risk (Batch Processing Version) — TKA_revisions
text: function calculates risk TKA revision individuals across cycles simulation output. batch-processing alternative per-cycle revisions_fcn. model uses linear predictor individual risk spline function baseline hazard time.

title: Calculate TKA Revision Risk (Batch Processing Version) — TKA_revisions
Calculate TKA Revision Risk (Batch Processing Version) — TKA_revisions
text: am_all data.frame representing full simulation output, containing data individuals cycles. cycle.coefficents data.frame list containing model coefficients revision model (names starting "cr_").

title: Calculate TKA Revision Risk (Batch Processing Version) — TKA_revisions
text: input am_all data.frame added columns revision hazards binary indicators revision events.

title: Update Total Knee Arthroplasty (TKA) Status — TKA_update_fcn

title: Resource Allocation Module — define_hospital_types
text: module implements comprehensive resource allocation modeling Australian healthcare system within AUS-OA microsimulation framework.

title: Resource Allocation Module — define_hospital_types
text: Key Features: Hospital capacity modeling type (public/private, metro/regional) Regional capacity variations referral patterns Dynamic capacity allocation based demand Resource utilization tracking Capacity constraint impacts wait times outcomes Integration existing waiting list pathways modules Australian Healthcare Context: Public hospitals: Government-funded, universal access, capacity constraints Private hospitals: Fee--service, faster access, capacity varies region Regional variations: Metro areas capacity, rural areas less Referral patterns: Complex patients may referred specialized centers Define Hospital Types Capacity Structure

title: Probabilistic Sensitivity Analysis (PSA) Framework — define_parameter_distributions
text: Key Features: Monte Carlo parameter sampling uncertainty distributions Convergence diagnostics statistical properties validation Integration existing simulation framework Support various probability distributions (normal, beta, gamma, etc.) Efficient sampling algorithms high-dimensional parameter spaces Comprehensive PSA result analysis reporting PSA Methodology: Parameter uncertainty quantification using evidence-based distributions Monte Carlo simulation multiple parameter sets Convergence assessment using statistical diagnostics Cost-effectiveness analysis uncertainty Probabilistic results interpretation Define Parameter Distributions PSA
